text: Now all these things happened to them by way of example, and they were written for our admonition, on whom the ends of the ages have come.

name: 1 Corinthians 10:12
text: Therefore let him who thinks he stands be careful that he doesn"t fall.

name: 1 Corinthians 10:13
text: No temptation has taken you except what is common to man. God is faithful, who will not allow you to be tempted above what you are able, but will with the temptation also make the way of escape, that you may be able to endure it.

name: 1 Corinthians 10:14
text: Therefore, my beloved, flee from idolatry.

name: 1 Corinthians 10:15
text: I speak as to wise men. Judge what I say.

name: 1 Corinthians 10:16
text: The cup of blessing which we bless, isn"t it a sharing of the blood of Christ? The bread which we break, isn"t it a sharing of the body of Christ?

name: 1 Corinthians 10:17
text: Because there is one loaf of bread, we, who are many, are one body; for we all partake of the one loaf of bread.

name: 1 Corinthians 10:18
text: Consider Israel according to the flesh. Don"t those who eat the sacrifices participate in the altar?

name: 1 Corinthians 10:19
text: What am I saying then? That a thing sacrificed to idols is anything, or that an idol is anything?

name: 1 Corinthians 10:20
text: But I say that the things which the Gentiles sacrifice, they sacrifice to demons, and not to God, and I don"t desire that you would have fellowship with demons.

name: 1 Corinthians 10:21
text: You can"t both drink the cup of the Lord and the cup of demons. You can"t both partake of the table of the Lord, and of the table of demons.

name: 1 Corinthians 10:22
text: Or do we provoke the Lord to jealousy? Are we stronger than he?

name: 1 Corinthians 10:23
text: "All things are lawful for me," but not all things are profitable. "All things are lawful for me," but not all things build up.

name: 1 Corinthians 10:24
text: Let no one seek his own, but each one his neighbor"s good.

name: 1 Corinthians 10:25
text: Whatever is sold in the butcher shop, eat, asking no question for the sake of conscience,

name: 1 Corinthians 10:26
text: for "the earth is the Lord"s, and its fullness."

name: 1 Corinthians 10:27
text: But if one of those who don"t believe invites you to a meal, and you are inclined to go, eat whatever is set before you, asking no questions for the sake of conscience.

name: 1 Corinthians 10:28
text: But if anyone says to you, "This was offered to idols," don"t eat it for the sake of the one who told you, and for the sake of conscience. For "the earth is the Lord"s, and all its fullness."

name: 1 Corinthians 10:29
text: Conscience, I say, not your own, but the other"s conscience. For why is my liberty judged by another conscience?

name: 1 Corinthians 10:30
text: If I partake with thankfulness, why am I denounced for that for which I give thanks?

name: 1 Corinthians 10:31
text: Whether therefore you eat, or drink, or whatever you do, do all to the glory of God.

name: 1 Corinthians 10:32
text: Give no occasions for stumbling, either to Jews, or to Greeks, or to the assembly of God;

name: 1 Corinthians 10:33
text: even as I also please all men in all things, not seeking my own profit, but the profit of the many, that they may be saved.

name: 1 Corinthians 11:1
text: Be imitators of me, even as I also am of Christ.

name: 1 Corinthians 11:2
text: Now I praise you, brothers, that you remember me in all things, and hold firm the traditions, even as I delivered them to you.

name: 1 Corinthians 11:3
text: But I would have you know that the head of every man is Christ, and the head of the woman is the man, and the head of Christ is God.

name: 1 Corinthians 11:4
text: Every man praying or prophesying, having his head covered, dishonors his head.

name: 1 Corinthians 11:5
text: But every woman praying or prophesying with her head unveiled dishonors her head. For it is one and the same thing as if she were shaved.

name: 1 Corinthians 11:6
text: For if a woman is not covered, let her also be shorn. But if it is shameful for a woman to be shorn or shaved, let her be covered.

name: 1 Corinthians 11:7
text: For a man indeed ought not to have his head covered, because he is the image and glory of God, but the woman is the glory of the man.

name: 1 Corinthians 11:8
text: For man is not from woman, but woman from man;

name: 1 Corinthians 11:9
text: for neither was man created for the woman, but woman for the man.

name: 1 Corinthians 11:10
text: For this cause the woman ought to have authority on her head, because of the angels.

name: 1 Corinthians 11:11
text: Nevertheless, neither is the woman independent of the man, nor the man independent of the woman, in the Lord.

name: 1 Corinthians 11:12
text: For as woman came from man, so a man also comes through a woman; but all things are from God.

name: 1 Corinthians 11:13
text: Judge for yourselves. Is it appropriate that a woman pray to God unveiled?

name: 1 Corinthians 11:14
text: Doesn"t even nature itself teach you that if a man has long hair, it is a dishonor to him?

name: 1 Corinthians 11:15
text: But if a woman has long hair, it is a glory to her, for her hair is given to her for a covering.

name: 1 Corinthians 11:16
text: But if any man seems to be contentious, we have no such custom, neither do God"s assemblies.

name: 1 Corinthians 11:17
text: But in giving you this command, I don"t praise you, that you come together not for the better but for the worse.

name: 1 Corinthians 11:18
text: For first of all, when you come together in the assembly, I hear that divisions exist among you, and I partly believe it.

name: 1 Corinthians 11:19
text: For there also must be factions among you, that those who are approved may be revealed among you.

name: 1 Corinthians 11:20
text: When therefore you assemble yourselves together, it is not the Lord"s supper that you eat.

name: 1 Corinthians 11:21
text: For in your eating each one takes his own supper first. One is hungry, and another is drunken.

name: 1 Corinthians 11:22
text: What, don"t you have houses to eat and to drink in? Or do you despise God"s assembly, and put them to shame who don"t have? What shall I tell you? Shall I praise you? In this I don"t praise you.

name: 1 Corinthians 11:23
text: For I received from the Lord that which also I delivered to you, that the Lord Jesus on the night in which he was betrayed took bread.

name: 1 Corinthians 11:24
text: When he had given thanks, he broke it, and said, "Take, eat. This is my body, which is broken for you. Do this in memory of me."

name: 1 Corinthians 11:25
text: In the same way he also took the cup, after supper, saying, "This cup is the new covenant in my blood. Do this, as often as you drink, in memory of me."

name: 1 Corinthians 11:26
text: For as often as you eat this bread and drink this cup, you proclaim the Lord"s death until he comes.

name: 1 Corinthians 11:27
text: Therefore whoever eats this bread or drinks the Lord"s cup in a way unworthy of the Lord will be guilty of the body and the blood of the Lord.

name: 1 Corinthians 11:28
text: But let a man examine himself, and so let him eat of the bread, and drink of the cup.

name: 1 Corinthians 11:29
text: For he who eats and drinks in an unworthy way eats and drinks judgment to himself, if he doesn"t discern the Lord"s body.

name: 1 Corinthians 11:30
text: For this cause many among you are weak and sickly, and not a few sleep.

name: 1 Corinthians 11:31
text: For if we discerned ourselves, we wouldn"t be judged.

name: 1 Corinthians 11:32
text: But when we are judged, we are punished by the Lord, that we may not be condemned with the world.

name: 1 Corinthians 11:33
text: Therefore, my brothers, when you come together to eat, wait for one another.

name: 1 Corinthians 11:34
text: But if anyone is hungry, let him eat at home, lest your coming together be for judgment. The rest I will set in order whenever I come.

name: 1 Corinthians 12:1
text: Now concerning spiritual things, brothers, I don"t want you to be ignorant.

name: 1 Corinthians 12:2
text: You know that when you were heathen, you were led away to those mute idols, however you might be led.

name: 1 Corinthians 12:3
text: Therefore I make known to you that no man speaking by God"s Spirit says, "Jesus is accursed." No one can say, "Jesus is Lord," but by the Holy Spirit.

name: 1 Corinthians 12:4
text: Now there are various kinds of gifts, but the same Spirit.

name: 1 Corinthians 12:5
text: There are various kinds of service, and the same Lord.

name: 1 Corinthians 12:6
text: There are various kinds of workings, but the same God, who works all things in all.

name: 1 Corinthians 12:7
text: But to each one is given the manifestation of the Spirit for the profit of all.

name: 1 Corinthians 12:8
text: For to one is given through the Spirit the word of wisdom, and to another the word of knowledge, according to the same Spirit;

name: 1 Corinthians 12:9
text: to another faith, by the same Spirit; and to another gifts of healings, by the same Spirit;

name: 1 Corinthians 12:10
text: and to another workings of miracles; and to another prophecy; and to another discerning of spirits; to another different kinds of languages; and to another the interpretation of languages.

name: 1 Corinthians 12:11
text: But the one and the same Spirit works all of these, distributing to each one separately as he desires.

name: 1 Corinthians 12:12
text: For as the body is one, and has many members, and all the members of the body, being many, are one body; so also is Christ.

name: 1 Corinthians 12:13
text: For in one Spirit we were all baptized into one body, whether Jews or Greeks, whether bond or free; and were all given to drink into one Spirit.

name: 1 Corinthians 12:14
text: For the body is not one member, but many.

name: 1 Corinthians 12:15
text: If the foot would say, "Because I"m not the hand, I"m not part of the body," it is not therefore not part of the body.

name: 1 Corinthians 12:16
text: If the ear would say, "Because I"m not the eye, I"m not part of the body," it"s not therefore not part of the body.

name: 1 Corinthians 12:17
text: If the whole body were an eye, where would the hearing be? If the whole were hearing, where would the smelling be?

name: 1 Corinthians 12:18
text: But now God has set the members, each one of them, in the body, just as he desired.

name: 1 Corinthians 12:19
text: If they were all one member, where would the body be?

name: 1 Corinthians 12:20
text: But now they are many members, but one body.

name: 1 Corinthians 12:21
text: The eye can"t tell the hand, "I have no need for you," or again the head to the feet, "I have no need for you."

name: 1 Corinthians 12:22
text: No, much rather, those members of the body which seem to be weaker are necessary.

name: 1 Corinthians 12:23
text: Those parts of the body which we think to be less honorable, on those we bestow more abundant honor; and our unpresentable parts have more abundant propriety;

name: 1 Corinthians 12:24
text: whereas our presentable parts have no such need. But God composed the body together, giving more abundant honor to the inferior part,

name: 1 Corinthians 12:25
text: that there should be no division in the body, but that the members should have the same care for one another.

name: 1 Corinthians 12:26
text: When one member suffers, all the members suffer with it. Or when one member is honored, all the members rejoice with it.

name: 1 Corinthians 12:27
text: Now you are the body of Christ, and members individually.

name: 1 Corinthians 12:28
text: God has set some in the assembly: first apostles, second prophets, third teachers, then miracle workers, then gifts of healings, helps, governments, and various kinds of languages.

name: 1 Corinthians 12:29
text: Are all apostles? Are all prophets? Are all teachers? Are all miracle workers?

name: 1 Corinthians 12:30
text: Do all have gifts of healings? Do all speak with various languages? Do all interpret?

name: 1 Corinthians 12:31
text: But earnestly desire the best gifts. Moreover, I show a most excellent way to you.

name: 1 Corinthians 13:1
text: If I speak with the languages of men and of angels, but don"t have love, I have become sounding brass, or a clanging cymbal.

name: 1 Corinthians 13:2
text: If I have the gift of prophecy, and know all mysteries and all knowledge; and if I have all faith, so as to remove mountains, but don"t have love, I am nothing.

name: 1 Corinthians 13:3
text: If I dole out all my goods to feed the poor, and if I give my body to be burned, but don"t have love, it profits me nothing.

name: 1 Corinthians 13:4
text: Love is patient and is kind; love doesn"t envy. Love doesn"t brag, is not proud,

name: 1 Corinthians 13:5
text: doesn"t behave itself inappropriately, doesn"t seek its own way, is not provoked, takes no account of evil;

name: 1 Corinthians 13:6
text: doesn"t rejoice in unrighteousness, but rejoices with the truth;

name: 1 Corinthians 13:7
text: bears all things, believes all things, hopes all things, endures all things.

name: 1 Corinthians 13:8
text: Love never fails. But where there are prophecies, they will be done away with. Where there are various languages, they will cease. Where there is knowledge, it will be done away with.

name: 1 Corinthians 13:9
text: For we know in part, and we prophesy in part;

name: 1 Corinthians 13:10
text: but when that which is complete has come, then that which is partial will be done away with.

name: 1 Corinthians 13:11
text: When I was a child, I spoke as a child, I felt as a child, I thought as a child. Now that I have become a man, I have put away childish things.

name: 1 Corinthians 13:12
text: For now we see in a mirror, dimly, but then face to face. Now I know in part, but then I will know fully, even as I was also fully known.

name: 1 Corinthians 13:13
text: But now faith, hope, and love remain"these three. The greatest of these is love.

name: 1 Corinthians 14:1
text: Follow after love, and earnestly desire spiritual gifts, but especially that you may prophesy.

name: 1 Corinthians 14:2
text: For he who speaks in another language speaks not to men, but to God; for no one understands; but in the Spirit he speaks mysteries.

name: 1 Corinthians 14:3
text: But he who prophesies speaks to men for their edification, exhortation, and consolation.

name: 1 Corinthians 14:4
text: He who speaks in another language edifies himself, but he who prophesies edifies the assembly.

name: 1 Corinthians 14:5
text: Now I desire to have you all speak with other languages, but rather that you would prophesy. For he is greater who prophesies than he who speaks with other languages, unless he interprets, that the assembly may be built up.

name: 1 Corinthians 14:6
text: But now, brothers, if I come to you speaking with other languages, what would I profit you, unless I speak to you either by way of revelation, or of knowledge, or of prophesying, or of teaching?

name: 1 Corinthians 14:7
text: Even things without life, giving a voice, whether pipe or harp, if they didn"t give a distinction in the sounds, how would it be known what is piped or harped?

name: 1 Corinthians 14:8
text: For if the trumpet gave an uncertain sound, who would prepare himself for war?

name: 1 Corinthians 14:9
text: So also you, unless you uttered by the tongue words easy to understand, how would it be known what is spoken? For you would be speaking into the air.

name: 1 Corinthians 14:10
text: There are, it may be, so many kinds of sounds in the world, and none of them is without meaning.

name: 1 Corinthians 14:11
text: If then I don"t know the meaning of the sound, I would be to him who speaks a foreigner, and he who speaks would be a foreigner to me.

name: 1 Corinthians 14:12
text: So also you, since you are zealous for spiritual gifts, seek that you may abound to the building up of the assembly.

name: 1 Corinthians 14:13
text: Therefore let him who speaks in another language pray that he may interpret.

name: 1 Corinthians 14:14
text: For if I pray in another language, my spirit prays, but my understanding is unfruitful.

name: 1 Corinthians 14:15
text: What is it then? I will pray with the spirit, and I will pray with the understanding also. I will sing with the spirit, and I will sing with the understanding also.

name: 1 Corinthians 14:16
text: Otherwise if you bless with the spirit, how will he who fills the place of the unlearned say the "Amen" at your giving of thanks, seeing he doesn"t know what you say?

name: 1 Corinthians 14:17
text: For you most certainly give thanks well, but the other person is not built up.

name: 1 Corinthians 14:18
text: I thank my God, I speak with other languages more than you all.

name: 1 Corinthians 14:19
text: However in the assembly I would rather speak five words with my understanding, that I might instruct others also, than ten thousand words in another language.

name: 1 Corinthians 14:20
text: Brothers, don"t be children in thoughts, yet in malice be babies, but in thoughts be mature.

name: 1 Corinthians 14:21
text: In the law it is written, "By men of strange languages and by the lips of strangers I will speak to this people. Not even thus will they hear me, says the Lord."

name: 1 Corinthians 14:22
text: Therefore other languages are for a sign, not to those who believe, but to the unbelieving; but prophesying is for a sign, not to the unbelieving, but to those who believe.

name: 1 Corinthians 14:23
text: If therefore the whole assembly is assembled together and all speak with other languages, and unlearned or unbelieving people come in, won"t they say that you are crazy?

name: 1 Corinthians 14:24
text: But if all prophesy, and someone unbelieving or unlearned comes in, he is reproved by all, and he is judged by all.

name: 1 Corinthians 14:25
text: And thus the secrets of his heart are revealed. So he will fall down on his face and worship God, declaring that God is among you indeed.

name: 1 Corinthians 14:26
text: What is it then, brothers? When you come together, each one of you has a psalm, has a teaching, has a revelation, has another language, has an interpretation. Let all things be done to build each other up.

name: 1 Corinthians 14:27
text: If any man speaks in another language, let it be two, or at the most three, and in turn; and let one interpret.

name: 1 Corinthians 14:28
text: But if there is no interpreter, let him keep silent in the assembly, and let him speak to himself, and to God.

name: 1 Corinthians 14:29
text: Let the prophets speak, two or three, and let the others discern.

name: 1 Corinthians 14:30
text: But if a revelation is made to another sitting by, let the first keep silent.

name: 1 Corinthians 14:31
text: For you all can prophesy one by one, that all may learn, and all may be exhorted.

name: 1 Corinthians 14:32
text: The spirits of the prophets are subject to the prophets,

name: 1 Corinthians 14:33
text: for God is not a God of confusion, but of peace. As in all the assemblies of the saints,

name: 1 Corinthians 14:34
text: let your wives keep silent in the assemblies, for it has not been permitted for them to speak; but let them be in subjection, as the law also says.

name: 1 Corinthians 14:35
text: If they desire to learn anything, let them ask their own husbands at home, for it is shameful for a woman to chatter in the assembly.

name: 1 Corinthians 14:36
text: What? Was it from you that the word of God went out? Or did it come to you alone?

name: 1 Corinthians 14:37
text: If any man thinks himself to be a prophet, or spiritual, let him recognize the things which I write to you, that they are the commandment of the Lord.

name: 1 Corinthians 14:38
text: But if anyone is ignorant, let him be ignorant.

name: 1 Corinthians 14:39
text: Therefore, brothers, desire earnestly to prophesy, and don"t forbid speaking with other languages.

name: 1 Corinthians 14:40
text: Let all things be done decently and in order.

name: 1 Corinthians 15:1
text: Now I declare to you, brothers, the Good News which I preached to you, which also you received, in which you also stand,

name: 1 Corinthians 15:2
text: by which also you are saved, if you hold firmly the word which I preached to you"unless you believed in vain.

name: 1 Corinthians 15:3
text: For I delivered to you first of all that which I also received: that Christ died for our sins according to the Scriptures,

name: 1 Corinthians 15:4
text: that he was buried, that he was raised on the third day according to the Scriptures,

name: 1 Corinthians 15:5
text: and that he appeared to Cephas, then to the twelve.

name: 1 Corinthians 15:6
text: Then he appeared to over five hundred brothers at once, most of whom remain until now, but some have also fallen asleep.

name: 1 Corinthians 15:7
text: Then he appeared to James, then to all the apostles,

name: 1 Corinthians 15:8
text: and last of all, as to the child born at the wrong time, he appeared to me also.

name: 1 Corinthians 15:9
text: For I am the least of the apostles, who is not worthy to be called an apostle, because I persecuted the assembly of God.

name: 1 Corinthians 15:10
text: But by the grace of God I am what I am. His grace which was bestowed on me was not futile, but I worked more than all of them; yet not I, but the grace of God which was with me.

name: 1 Corinthians 15:11
text: Whether then it is I or they, so we preach, and so you believed.

name: 1 Corinthians 15:12
text: Now if Christ is preached, that he has been raised from the dead, how do some among you say that there is no resurrection of the dead?

name: 1 Corinthians 15:13
text: But if there is no resurrection of the dead, neither has Christ been raised.

name: 1 Corinthians 15:14
text: If Christ has not been raised, then our preaching is in vain, and your faith also is in vain.

name: 1 Corinthians 15:15
text: Yes, we are found false witnesses of God, because we testified about God that he raised up Christ, whom he didn"t raise up, if it is so that the dead are not raised.

name: 1 Corinthians 15:16
text: For if the dead aren"t raised, neither has Christ been raised.

name: 1 Corinthians 15:17
text: If Christ has not been raised, your faith is vain; you are still in your sins.

name: 1 Corinthians 15:18
text: Then they also who are fallen asleep in Christ have perished.

name: 1 Corinthians 15:19
text: If we have only hoped in Christ in this life, we are of all men most pitiable.

name: 1 Corinthians 15:20
text: But now Christ has been raised from the dead. He became the first fruits of those who are asleep.

name: 1 Corinthians 15:21
text: For since death came by man, the resurrection of the dead also came by man.

name: 1 Corinthians 15:22
text: For as in Adam all die, so also in Christ all will be made alive.

name: 1 Corinthians 15:23
text: But each in his own order: Christ the first fruits, then those who are Christ"s, at his coming.

name: 1 Corinthians 15:24
text: Then the end comes, when he will deliver up the Kingdom to God, even the Father; when he will have abolished all rule and all authority and power.

name: 1 Corinthians 15:25
text: For he must reign until he has put all his enemies under his feet.

name: 1 Corinthians 15:26
text: The last enemy that will be abolished is death.

name: 1 Corinthians 15:27
text: For, "He put all things in subjection under his feet." But when he says, "All things are put in subjection," it is evident that he is excepted who subjected all things to him.

name: 1 Corinthians 15:28
text: When all things have been subjected to him, then the Son will also himself be subjected to him who subjected all things to him, that God may be all in all.

name: 1 Corinthians 15:29
text: Or else what will they do who are baptized for the dead? If the dead aren"t raised at all, why then are they baptized for the dead?

name: 1 Corinthians 15:30
text: Why do we also stand in jeopardy every hour?

name: 1 Corinthians 15:31
text: I affirm, by the boasting in you which I have in Christ Jesus our Lord, I die daily.

name: 1 Corinthians 15:32
text: If I fought with animals at Ephesus for human purposes, what does it profit me? If the dead are not raised, then "let us eat and drink, for tomorrow we die."

name: 1 Corinthians 15:33
text: Don"t be deceived! "Evil companionships corrupt good morals."

name: 1 Corinthians 15:34
text: Wake up righteously, and don"t sin, for some have no knowledge of God. I say this to your shame.

name: 1 Corinthians 15:35
text: But someone will say, "How are the dead raised?" and, "With what kind of body do they come?"

name: 1 Corinthians 15:36
text: You foolish one, that which you yourself sow is not made alive unless it dies.

name: 1 Corinthians 15:37
text: That which you sow, you don"t sow the body that will be, but a bare grain, maybe of wheat, or of some other kind.

name: 1 Corinthians 15:38
text: But God gives it a body even as it pleased him, and to each seed a body of its own.

name: 1 Corinthians 15:39
text: All flesh is not the same flesh, but there is one flesh of men, another flesh of animals, another of fish, and another of birds.

name: 1 Corinthians 15:40
text: There are also celestial bodies, and terrestrial bodies; but the glory of the celestial differs from that of the terrestrial.

name: 1 Corinthians 15:41
text: There is one glory of the sun, another glory of the moon, and another glory of the stars; for one star differs from another star in glory.

name: 1 Corinthians 15:42
text: So also is the resurrection of the dead. It is sown in corruption; it is raised in incorruption.

name: 1 Corinthians 15:43
text: It is sown in dishonor; it is raised in glory. It is sown in weakness; it is raised in power.

name: 1 Corinthians 15:44
text: It is sown a natural body; it is raised a spiritual body. There is a natural body and there is also a spiritual body.

name: 1 Corinthians 15:45
text: So also it is written, "The first man, Adam, became a living soul." The last Adam became a life-giving spirit.

name: 1 Corinthians 15:46
text: However that which is spiritual isn"t first, but that which is natural, then that which is spiritual.

name: 1 Corinthians 15:47
text: The first man is of the earth, made of dust. The second man is the Lord from heaven.

name: 1 Corinthians 15:48
text: As is the one made of dust, such are those who are also made of dust; and as is the heavenly, such are they also that are heavenly.

name: 1 Corinthians 15:49
text: As we have borne the image of those made of dust, let"s also bear the image of the heavenly.

name: 1 Corinthians 15:50
text: Now I say this, brothers, that flesh and blood can"t inherit the Kingdom of God; neither does corruption inherit incorruption.

name: 1 Corinthians 15:51
text: Behold, I tell you a mystery. We will not all sleep, but we will all be changed,

name: 1 Corinthians 15:52
text: in a moment, in the twinkling of an eye, at the last trumpet. For the trumpet will sound, and the dead will be raised incorruptible, and we will be changed.

name: 1 Corinthians 15:53
text: For this corruptible must put on incorruption, and this mortal must put on immortality.

name: 1 Corinthians 15:54
text: But when this corruptible will have put on incorruption, and this mortal will have put on immortality, then what is written will happen: "Death is swallowed up in victory."

name: 1 Corinthians 15:55
text: "Death, where is your sting? Hades, where is your victory?"

name: 1 Corinthians 15:56
text: The sting of death is sin, and the power of sin is the law.

name: 1 Corinthians 15:57
text: But thanks be to God, who gives us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ.

name: 1 Corinthians 15:58
text: Therefore, my beloved brothers, be steadfast, immovable, always abounding in the Lord"s work, because you know that your labor is not in vain in the Lord.

name: 1 Corinthians 16:1
text: Now concerning the collection for the saints, as I commanded the assemblies of Galatia, you do likewise.

name: 1 Corinthians 16:2
text: On the first day of the week, let each one of you save, as he may prosper, that no collections be made when I come.

name: 1 Corinthians 16:3
text: When I arrive, I will send whoever you approve with letters to carry your gracious gift to Jerusalem.

name: 1 Corinthians 16:4
text: If it is appropriate for me to go also, they will go with me.

name: 1 Corinthians 16:5
text: But I will come to you when I have passed through Macedonia, for I am passing through Macedonia.

name: 1 Corinthians 16:6
text: But with you it may be that I will stay, or even winter, that you may send me on my journey wherever I go.

name: 1 Corinthians 16:7
text: For I do not wish to see you now in passing, but I hope to stay a while with you, if the Lord permits.

name: 1 Corinthians 16:8
text: But I will stay at Ephesus until Pentecost,

name: 1 Corinthians 16:9
text: for a great and effective door has opened to me, and there are many adversaries.

name: 1 Corinthians 16:10
text: Now if Timothy comes, see that he is with you without fear, for he does the work of the Lord, as I also do.

name: 1 Corinthians 16:11
text: Therefore let no one despise him. But set him forward on his journey in peace, that he may come to me; for I expect him with the brothers.

name: 1 Corinthians 16:12
text: Now concerning Apollos, the brother, I strongly urged him to come to you with the brothers; and it was not at all his desire to come now; but he will come when he has an opportunity.

name: 1 Corinthians 16:13
text: Watch! Stand firm in the faith! Be courageous! Be strong!

name: 1 Corinthians 16:14
text: Let all that you do be done in love.

name: 1 Corinthians 16:15
text: Now I beg you, brothers (you know the house of Stephanas, that it is the first fruits of Achaia, and that they have set themselves to serve the saints),

name: 1 Corinthians 16:16
text: that you also be in subjection to such, and to everyone who helps in the work and labors.

name: 1 Corinthians 16:17
text: I rejoice at the coming of Stephanas, Fortunatus, and Achaicus; for that which was lacking on your part, they supplied.

name: 1 Corinthians 16:18
text: For they refreshed my spirit and yours. Therefore acknowledge those who are like that.

name: 1 Corinthians 16:19
text: The assemblies of Asia greet you. Aquila and Priscilla greet you much in the Lord, together with the assembly that is in their house.

name: 1 Corinthians 16:20
text: All the brothers greet you. Greet one another with a holy kiss.

name: 1 Corinthians 16:21
text: This greeting is by me, Paul, with my own hand.

name: 1 Corinthians 16:22
text: If any man doesn"t love the Lord Jesus Christ, let him be accursed. Come, Lord!

name: 1 Corinthians 16:23
text: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with you.

name: 1 Corinthians 16:24
text: My love to all of you in Christ Jesus. Amen.

name: 2 Corinthians 1:1
text: Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus through the will of God, and Timothy our brother, to the assembly of God which is at Corinth, with all the saints who are in the whole of Achaia:

name: 2 Corinthians 1:2
text: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

name: 2 Corinthians 1:3
text: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of mercies and God of all comfort;

name: 2 Corinthians 1:4
text: who comforts us in all our affliction, that we may be able to comfort those who are in any affliction, through the comfort with which we ourselves are comforted by God.

name: 2 Corinthians 1:5
text: For as the sufferings of Christ abound to us, even so our comfort also abounds through Christ.

name: 2 Corinthians 1:6
text: But if we are afflicted, it is for your comfort and salvation. If we are comforted, it is for your comfort, which produces in you the patient enduring of the same sufferings which we also suffer.

name: 2 Corinthians 1:7
text: Our hope for you is steadfast, knowing that, since you are partakers of the sufferings, so also are you of the comfort.

name: 2 Corinthians 1:8
text: For we don"t desire to have you uninformed, brothers, concerning our affliction which happened to us in Asia, that we were weighed down exceedingly, beyond our power, so much that we despaired even of life.

name: 2 Corinthians 1:9
text: Yes, we ourselves have had the sentence of death within ourselves, that we should not trust in ourselves, but in God who raises the dead,

name: 2 Corinthians 1:10
text: who delivered us out of so great a death, and does deliver; on whom we have set our hope that he will also still deliver us;

name: 2 Corinthians 1:11
text: you also helping together on our behalf by your supplication; that, for the gift bestowed on us by means of many, thanks may be given by many persons on your behalf.

name: 2 Corinthians 1:12
text: For our boasting is this: the testimony of our conscience, that in holiness and sincerity of God, not in fleshly wisdom but in the grace of God we behaved ourselves in the world, and more abundantly toward you.

name: 2 Corinthians 1:13
text: For we write no other things to you, than what you read or even acknowledge, and I hope you will acknowledge to the end;

name: 2 Corinthians 1:14
text: as also you acknowledged us in part, that we are your boasting, even as you also are ours, in the day of our Lord Jesus.

name: 2 Corinthians 1:15
text: In this confidence, I was determined to come first to you, that you might have a second benefit;

name: 2 Corinthians 1:16
text: and by you to pass into Macedonia, and again from Macedonia to come to you, and to be sent forward by you on my journey to Judea.

name: 2 Corinthians 1:17
text: When I therefore was thus determined, did I show fickleness? Or the things that I purpose, do I purpose according to the flesh, that with me there should be the "Yes, yes" and the "No, no?"

name: 2 Corinthians 1:18
text: But as God is faithful, our word toward you was not "Yes and no."

name: 2 Corinthians 1:19
text: For the Son of God, Jesus Christ, who was preached among you by us, by me, Silvanus, and Timothy, was not "Yes and no," but in him is "Yes."

name: 2 Corinthians 1:20
text: For however many are the promises of God, in him is the "Yes." Therefore also through him is the "Amen," to the glory of God through us.

name: 2 Corinthians 1:21
text: Now he who establishes us with you in Christ, and anointed us, is God;

name: 2 Corinthians 1:22
text: who also sealed us, and gave us the down payment of the Spirit in our hearts.

name: 2 Corinthians 1:23
text: But I call God for a witness to my soul, that I didn"t come to Corinth to spare you.

name: 2 Corinthians 1:24
text: Not that we have lordship over your faith, but are fellow workers with you for your joy. For you stand firm in faith.

name: 2 Corinthians 2:1
text: But I determined this for myself, that I would not come to you again in sorrow.

name: 2 Corinthians 2:2
text: For if I make you sorry, then who will make me glad but he who is made sorry by me?

name: 2 Corinthians 2:3
text: And I wrote this very thing to you, so that, when I came, I wouldn"t have sorrow from them of whom I ought to rejoice; having confidence in you all, that my joy would be shared by all of you.

name: 2 Corinthians 2:4
text: For out of much affliction and anguish of heart I wrote to you with many tears, not that you should be made sorry, but that you might know the love that I have so abundantly for you.

name: 2 Corinthians 2:5
text: But if any has caused sorrow, he has caused sorrow, not to me, but in part (that I not press too heavily) to you all.

name: 2 Corinthians 2:6
text: Sufficient to such a one is this punishment which was inflicted by the many;

name: 2 Corinthians 2:7
text: so that on the contrary you should rather forgive him and comfort him, lest by any means such a one should be swallowed up with his excessive sorrow.

name: 2 Corinthians 2:8
text: Therefore I beg you to confirm your love toward him.

name: 2 Corinthians 2:9
text: For to this end I also wrote, that I might know the proof of you, whether you are obedient in all things.

name: 2 Corinthians 2:10
text: Now I also forgive whomever you forgive anything. For if indeed I have forgiven anything, I have forgiven that one for your sakes in the presence of Christ,

name: 2 Corinthians 2:11
text: that no advantage may be gained over us by Satan; for we are not ignorant of his schemes.

name: 2 Corinthians 2:12
text: Now when I came to Troas for the Good News of Christ, and when a door was opened to me in the Lord,

name: 2 Corinthians 2:13
text: I had no relief for my spirit, because I didn"t find Titus, my brother, but taking my leave of them, I went out into Macedonia.

name: 2 Corinthians 2:14
text: Now thanks be to God, who always leads us in triumph in Christ, and reveals through us the sweet aroma of his knowledge in every place.

name: 2 Corinthians 2:15
text: For we are a sweet aroma of Christ to God, in those who are saved, and in those who perish;

name: 2 Corinthians 2:16
text: to the one a stench from death to death; to the other a sweet aroma from life to life. Who is sufficient for these things?

name: 2 Corinthians 2:17
text: For we are not as so many, peddling the word of God. But as of sincerity, but as of God, in the sight of God, we speak in Christ.

name: 2 Corinthians 3:1
text: Are we beginning again to commend ourselves? Or do we need, as do some, letters of commendation to you or from you?

name: 2 Corinthians 3:2
text: You are our letter, written in our hearts, known and read by all men;

name: 2 Corinthians 3:3
text: being revealed that you are a letter of Christ, served by us, written not with ink, but with the Spirit of the living God; not in tablets of stone, but in tablets that are hearts of flesh.

name: 2 Corinthians 3:4
text: Such confidence we have through Christ toward God;

name: 2 Corinthians 3:5
text: not that we are sufficient of ourselves, to account anything as from ourselves; but our sufficiency is from God;

name: 2 Corinthians 3:6
text: who also made us sufficient as servants of a new covenant; not of the letter, but of the Spirit. For the letter kills, but the Spirit gives life.

name: 2 Corinthians 3:7
text: But if the service of death, written engraved on stones, came with glory, so that the children of Israel could not look steadfastly on the face of Moses for the glory of his face; which was passing away:

name: 2 Corinthians 3:8
text: won"t service of the Spirit be with much more glory?

name: 2 Corinthians 3:9
text: For if the service of condemnation has glory, the service of righteousness exceeds much more in glory.

name: 2 Corinthians 3:10
text: For most certainly that which has been made glorious has not been made glorious in this respect, by reason of the glory that surpasses.

name: 2 Corinthians 3:11
text: For if that which passes away was with glory, much more that which remains is in glory.

name: 2 Corinthians 3:12
text: Having therefore such a hope, we use great boldness of speech,

name: 2 Corinthians 3:13
text: and not as Moses, who put a veil on his face, that the children of Israel wouldn"t look steadfastly on the end of that which was passing away.

name: 2 Corinthians 3:14
text: But their minds were hardened, for until this very day at the reading of the old covenant the same veil remains, because in Christ it passes away.

name: 2 Corinthians 3:15
text: But to this day, when Moses is read, a veil lies on their heart.

name: 2 Corinthians 3:16
text: But whenever one turns to the Lord, the veil is taken away.

name: 2 Corinthians 3:17
text: Now the Lord is the Spirit and where the Spirit of the Lord is, there is liberty.

name: 2 Corinthians 3:18
text: But we all, with unveiled face beholding as in a mirror the glory of the Lord, are transformed into the same image from glory to glory, even as from the Lord, the Spirit.

name: 2 Corinthians 4:1
text: Therefore seeing we have this ministry, even as we obtained mercy, we don"t faint.

name: 2 Corinthians 4:2
text: But we have renounced the hidden things of shame, not walking in craftiness, nor handling the word of God deceitfully; but by the manifestation of the truth commending ourselves to every man"s conscience in the sight of God.

name: 2 Corinthians 4:3
text: Even if our Good News is veiled, it is veiled in those who perish;

name: 2 Corinthians 4:4
text: in whom the god of this world has blinded the minds of the unbelieving, that the light of the Good News of the glory of Christ, who is the image of God, should not dawn on them.

name: 2 Corinthians 4:5
text: For we don"t preach ourselves, but Christ Jesus as Lord, and ourselves as your servants for Jesus" sake;

name: 2 Corinthians 4:6
text: seeing it is God who said, "Light will shine out of darkness," who has shone in our hearts, to give the light of the knowledge of the glory of God in the face of Jesus Christ.

name: 2 Corinthians 4:7
text: But we have this treasure in clay vessels, that the exceeding greatness of the power may be of God, and not from ourselves.

name: 2 Corinthians 4:8
text: We are pressed on every side, yet not crushed; perplexed, yet not to despair;

name: 2 Corinthians 4:9
text: pursued, yet not forsaken; struck down, yet not destroyed;

name: 2 Corinthians 4:10
text: always carrying in the body the putting to death of the Lord Jesus, that the life of Jesus may also be revealed in our body.

name: 2 Corinthians 4:11
text: For we who live are always delivered to death for Jesus" sake, that the life also of Jesus may be revealed in our mortal flesh.

name: 2 Corinthians 4:12
text: So then death works in us, but life in you.

name: 2 Corinthians 4:13
text: But having the same spirit of faith, according to that which is written, "I believed, and therefore I spoke." We also believe, and therefore also we speak;

name: 2 Corinthians 4:14
text: knowing that he who raised the Lord Jesus will raise us also with Jesus, and will present us with you.

name: 2 Corinthians 4:15
text: For all things are for your sakes, that the grace, being multiplied through the many, may cause the thanksgiving to abound to the glory of God.

name: 2 Corinthians 4:16
text: Therefore we don"t faint, but though our outward man is decaying, yet our inward man is renewed day by day.

name: 2 Corinthians 4:17
text: For our light affliction, which is for the moment, works for us more and more exceedingly an eternal weight of glory;

name: 2 Corinthians 4:18
text: while we don"t look at the things which are seen, but at the things which are not seen. For the things which are seen are temporal, but the things which are not seen are eternal.

name: 2 Corinthians 5:1
text: For we know that if the earthly house of our tent is dissolved, we have a building from God, a house not made with hands, eternal, in the heavens.

name: 2 Corinthians 5:2
text: For most certainly in this we groan, longing to be clothed with our habitation which is from heaven;

name: 2 Corinthians 5:3
text: if so be that being clothed we will not be found naked.

name: 2 Corinthians 5:4
text: For indeed we who are in this tent do groan, being burdened; not that we desire to be unclothed, but that we desire to be clothed, that what is mortal may be swallowed up by life.

name: 2 Corinthians 5:5
text: Now he who made us for this very thing is God, who also gave to us the down payment of the Spirit.

name: 2 Corinthians 5:6
text: Therefore, we are always confident and know that while we are at home in the body, we are absent from the Lord;

name: 2 Corinthians 5:7
text: for we walk by faith, not by sight.

name: 2 Corinthians 5:8
text: We are courageous, I say, and are willing rather to be absent from the body, and to be at home with the Lord.

name: 2 Corinthians 5:9
text: Therefore also we make it our aim, whether at home or absent, to be well pleasing to him.

name: 2 Corinthians 5:10
text: For we must all be revealed before the judgment seat of Christ; that each one may receive the things in the body, according to what he has done, whether good or bad.

name: 2 Corinthians 5:11
text: Knowing therefore the fear of the Lord, we persuade men, but we are revealed to God; and I hope that we are revealed also in your consciences.

name: 2 Corinthians 5:12
text: For we are not commending ourselves to you again, but speak as giving you occasion of boasting on our behalf, that you may have something to answer those who boast in appearance, and not in heart.

name: 2 Corinthians 5:13
text: For if we are beside ourselves, it is for God. Or if we are of sober mind, it is for you.

name: 2 Corinthians 5:14
text: For the love of Christ constrains us; because we judge thus, that one died for all, therefore all died.

name: 2 Corinthians 5:15
text: He died for all, that those who live should no longer live to themselves, but to him who for their sakes died and rose again.

name: 2 Corinthians 5:16
text: Therefore we know no one after the flesh from now on. Even though we have known Christ after the flesh, yet now we know him so no more.

name: 2 Corinthians 5:17
text: Therefore if anyone is in Christ, he is a new creation. The old things have passed away. Behold, all things have become new.

name: 2 Corinthians 5:18
text: But all things are of God, who reconciled us to himself through Jesus Christ, and gave to us the ministry of reconciliation;

name: 2 Corinthians 5:19
text: namely, that God was in Christ reconciling the world to himself, not reckoning to them their trespasses, and having committed to us the word of reconciliation.

name: 2 Corinthians 5:20
text: We are therefore ambassadors on behalf of Christ, as though God were entreating by us: we beg you on behalf of Christ, be reconciled to God.

name: 2 Corinthians 5:21
text: For him who knew no sin he made to be sin on our behalf; so that in him we might become the righteousness of God.

name: 2 Corinthians 6:1
text: Working together, we entreat also that you not receive the grace of God in vain,

name: 2 Corinthians 6:2
text: for he says, "At an acceptable time I listened to you, in a day of salvation I helped you." Behold, now is the acceptable time. Behold, now is the day of salvation.

name: 2 Corinthians 6:3
text: We give no occasion of stumbling in anything, that our service may not be blamed,

name: 2 Corinthians 6:4
text: but in everything commending ourselves, as servants of God, in great endurance, in afflictions, in hardships, in distresses,

name: 2 Corinthians 6:5
text: in beatings, in imprisonments, in riots, in labors, in watchings, in fastings;

name: 2 Corinthians 6:6
text: in pureness, in knowledge, in patience, in kindness, in the Holy Spirit, in sincere love,

name: 2 Corinthians 6:7
text: in the word of truth, in the power of God; by the armor of righteousness on the right hand and on the left,

name: 2 Corinthians 6:8
text: by glory and dishonor, by evil report and good report; as deceivers, and yet true;

name: 2 Corinthians 6:9
text: as unknown, and yet well known; as dying, and behold, we live; as punished, and not killed;

name: 2 Corinthians 6:10
text: as sorrowful, yet always rejoicing; as poor, yet making many rich; as having nothing, and yet possessing all things.

name: 2 Corinthians 6:11
text: Our mouth is open to you, Corinthians. Our heart is enlarged.

name: 2 Corinthians 6:12
text: You are not restricted by us, but you are restricted by your own affections.

name: 2 Corinthians 6:13
text: Now in return, I speak as to my children, you also be open wide.

name: 2 Corinthians 6:14
text: Don"t be unequally yoked with unbelievers, for what fellowship have righteousness and iniquity? Or what fellowship has light with darkness?

name: 2 Corinthians 6:15
text: What agreement has Christ with Belial? Or what portion has a believer with an unbeliever?

name: 2 Corinthians 6:16
text: What agreement has a temple of God with idols? For you are a temple of the living God. Even as God said, "I will dwell in them, and walk in them; and I will be their God, and they will be my people."

name: 2 Corinthians 6:17
text: Therefore, ""Come out from among them, and be separate," says the Lord. "Touch no unclean thing. I will receive you.

name: 2 Corinthians 6:18
text: I will be to you a Father. You will be to me sons and daughters," says the Lord Almighty."

name: 2 Corinthians 7:1
text: Having therefore these promises, beloved, let us cleanse ourselves from all defilement of flesh and spirit, perfecting holiness in the fear of God.

name: 2 Corinthians 7:2
text: Open your hearts to us. We wronged no one. We corrupted no one. We took advantage of no one.

name: 2 Corinthians 7:3
text: I say this not to condemn you, for I have said before, that you are in our hearts to die together and live together.

name: 2 Corinthians 7:4
text: Great is my boldness of speech toward you. Great is my boasting on your behalf. I am filled with comfort. I overflow with joy in all our affliction.

name: 2 Corinthians 7:5
text: For even when we had come into Macedonia, our flesh had no relief, but we were afflicted on every side. Fightings were outside. Fear was inside.

name: 2 Corinthians 7:6
text: Nevertheless, he who comforts the lowly, God, comforted us by the coming of Titus;

name: 2 Corinthians 7:7
text: and not by his coming only, but also by the comfort with which he was comforted in you, while he told us of your longing, your mourning, and your zeal for me; so that I rejoiced still more.

name: 2 Corinthians 7:8
text: For though I made you sorry with my letter, I do not regret it, though I did regret it. For I see that my letter made you sorry, though just for a while.

name: 2 Corinthians 7:9
text: I now rejoice, not that you were made sorry, but that you were made sorry to repentance. For you were made sorry in a godly way, that you might suffer loss by us in nothing.

name: 2 Corinthians 7:10
text: For godly sorrow works repentance to salvation, which brings no regret. But the sorrow of the world works death.

name: 2 Corinthians 7:11
text: For behold, this same thing, that you were made sorry in a godly way, what earnest care it worked in you. Yes, what defense, indignation, fear, longing, zeal, and vengeance! In everything you demonstrated yourselves to be pure in the matter.

name: 2 Corinthians 7:12
text: So although I wrote to you, I wrote not for his cause that did the wrong, nor for his cause that suffered the wrong, but that your earnest care for us might be revealed in you in the sight of God.

name: 2 Corinthians 7:13
text: Therefore we have been comforted. In our comfort we rejoiced the more exceedingly for the joy of Titus, because his spirit has been refreshed by you all.

name: 2 Corinthians 7:14
text: For if in anything I have boasted to him on your behalf, I was not disappointed. But as we spoke all things to you in truth, so our glorying also which I made before Titus was found to be truth.

name: 2 Corinthians 7:15
text: His affection is more abundantly toward you, while he remembers all of your obedience, how with fear and trembling you received him.

name: 2 Corinthians 7:16
text: I rejoice that in everything I am confident concerning you.

name: 2 Corinthians 8:1
text: Moreover, brothers, we make known to you the grace of God which has been given in the assemblies of Macedonia;

name: 2 Corinthians 8:2
text: how that in much proof of affliction the abundance of their joy and their deep poverty abounded to the riches of their liberality.

name: 2 Corinthians 8:3
text: For according to their power, I testify, yes and beyond their power, they gave of their own accord,

name: 2 Corinthians 8:4
text: begging us with much entreaty to receive this grace and the fellowship in the service to the saints.

name: 2 Corinthians 8:5
text: This was not as we had hoped, but first they gave their own selves to the Lord, and to us through the will of God.

name: 2 Corinthians 8:6
text: So we urged Titus, that as he made a beginning before, so he would also complete in you this grace.

name: 2 Corinthians 8:7
text: But as you abound in everything, in faith, utterance, knowledge, all earnestness, and in your love to us, see that you also abound in this grace.

name: 2 Corinthians 8:8
text: I speak not by way of commandment, but as proving through the earnestness of others the sincerity also of your love.

name: 2 Corinthians 8:9
text: For you know the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, that, though he was rich, yet for your sakes he became poor, that you through his poverty might become rich.

name: 2 Corinthians 8:10
text: I give a judgment in this: for this is expedient for you, who were the first to start a year ago, not only to do, but also to be willing.

name: 2 Corinthians 8:11
text: But now complete the doing also, that as there was the readiness to be willing, so there may be the completion also out of your ability.

name: 2 Corinthians 8:12
text: For if the readiness is there, it is acceptable according to what you have, not according to what you don"t have.

name: 2 Corinthians 8:13
text: For this is not that others may be eased and you distressed,

name: 2 Corinthians 8:14
text: but for equality. Your abundance at this present time supplies their lack, that their abundance also may become a supply for your lack; that there may be equality.

name: 2 Corinthians 8:15
text: As it is written, "He who gathered much had nothing left over, and he who gathered little had no lack."

name: 2 Corinthians 8:16
text: But thanks be to God, who puts the same earnest care for you into the heart of Titus.

name: 2 Corinthians 8:17
text: For he indeed accepted our exhortation, but being himself very earnest, he went out to you of his own accord.

name: 2 Corinthians 8:18
text: We have sent together with him the brother whose praise in the Good News is known through all the assemblies.

name: 2 Corinthians 8:19
text: Not only so, but who was also appointed by the assemblies to travel with us in this grace, which is served by us to the glory of the Lord himself, and to show our readiness.

name: 2 Corinthians 8:20
text: We are avoiding this, that any man should blame us concerning this abundance which is administered by us.

name: 2 Corinthians 8:21
text: Having regard for honorable things, not only in the sight of the Lord, but also in the sight of men.

name: 2 Corinthians 8:22
text: We have sent with them our brother, whom we have many times proved earnest in many things, but now much more earnest, by reason of the great confidence which he has in you.

name: 2 Corinthians 8:23
text: As for Titus, he is my partner and fellow worker for you. As for our brothers, they are the apostles of the assemblies, the glory of Christ.

name: 2 Corinthians 8:24
text: Therefore show the proof of your love to them in front of the assemblies, and of our boasting on your behalf.

name: 2 Corinthians 9:1
text: It is indeed unnecessary for me to write to you concerning the service to the saints,

name: 2 Corinthians 9:2
text: for I know your readiness, of which I boast on your behalf to them of Macedonia, that Achaia has been prepared for a year past. Your zeal has stirred up very many of them.

name: 2 Corinthians 9:3
text: But I have sent the brothers that our boasting on your behalf may not be in vain in this respect, that, just as I said, you may be prepared,

name: 2 Corinthians 9:4
text: so that I won"t by any means, if there come with me any of Macedonia and find you unprepared, we (to say nothing of you) should be disappointed in this confident boasting.

name: 2 Corinthians 9:5
text: I thought it necessary therefore to entreat the brothers that they would go before to you, and arrange ahead of time the generous gift that you promised before, that the same might be ready as a matter of generosity, and not of greediness.

name: 2 Corinthians 9:6
text: Remember this: he who sows sparingly will also reap sparingly. He who sows bountifully will also reap bountifully.

name: 2 Corinthians 9:7
text: Let each man give according as he has determined in his heart; not grudgingly, or under compulsion; for God loves a cheerful giver.

name: 2 Corinthians 9:8
text: And God is able to make all grace abound to you, that you, always having all sufficiency in everything, may abound to every good work.

name: 2 Corinthians 9:9
text: As it is written, "He has scattered abroad, he has given to the poor. His righteousness remains forever."

name: 2 Corinthians 9:10
text: Now may he who supplies seed to the sower and bread for food, supply and multiply your seed for sowing, and increase the fruits of your righteousness;

name: 2 Corinthians 9:11
text: you being enriched in everything to all liberality, which works through us thanksgiving to God.

name: 2 Corinthians 9:12
text: For this service of giving that you perform not only makes up for lack among the saints, but abounds also through many givings of thanks to God;

name: 2 Corinthians 9:13
text: seeing that through the proof given by this service, they glorify God for the obedience of your confession to the Good News of Christ, and for the liberality of your contribution to them and to all;

name: 2 Corinthians 9:14
text: while they themselves also, with supplication on your behalf, yearn for you by reason of the exceeding grace of God in you.

name: 2 Corinthians 9:15
text: Now thanks be to God for his unspeakable gift!

name: 2 Corinthians 10:1
text: Now I Paul, myself, entreat you by the humility and gentleness of Christ; I who in your presence am lowly among you, but being absent am bold toward you.

name: 2 Corinthians 10:2
text: Yes, I beg you that I may not, when present, show courage with the confidence with which I intend to be bold against some, who consider us to be walking according to the flesh.

name: 2 Corinthians 10:3
text: For though we walk in the flesh, we don"t wage war according to the flesh;

name: 2 Corinthians 10:4
text: for the weapons of our warfare are not of the flesh, but mighty before God to the throwing down of strongholds,

name: 2 Corinthians 10:5
text: throwing down imaginations and every high thing that is exalted against the knowledge of God, and bringing every thought into captivity to the obedience of Christ;

name: 2 Corinthians 10:6
text: and being in readiness to avenge all disobedience, when your obedience will be made full.

name: 2 Corinthians 10:7
text: Do you look at things only as they appear in front of your face? If anyone trusts in himself that he is Christ"s, let him consider this again with himself, that, even as he is Christ"s, so also we are Christ"s.

name: 2 Corinthians 10:8
text: For though I should boast somewhat abundantly concerning our authority, (which the Lord gave for building you up, and not for casting you down) I will not be disappointed,

name: 2 Corinthians 10:9
text: that I may not seem as if I desire to terrify you by my letters.

name: 2 Corinthians 10:10
text: For, "His letters," they say, "are weighty and strong, but his bodily presence is weak, and his speech is despised."

name: 2 Corinthians 10:11
text: Let such a person consider this, that what we are in word by letters when we are absent, such are we also in deed when we are present.

name: 2 Corinthians 10:12
text: For we are not bold to number or compare ourselves with some of those who commend themselves. But they themselves, measuring themselves by themselves, and comparing themselves with themselves, are without understanding.

name: 2 Corinthians 10:13
text: But we will not boast beyond proper limits, but within the boundaries with which God appointed to us, which reach even to you.

name: 2 Corinthians 10:14
text: For we don"t stretch ourselves too much, as though we didn"t reach to you. For we came even as far as to you with the Good News of Christ,

name: 2 Corinthians 10:15
text: not boasting beyond proper limits in other men"s labors, but having hope that as your faith grows, we will be abundantly enlarged by you in our sphere of influence,

name: 2 Corinthians 10:16
text: so as to preach the Good News even to the parts beyond you, not to boast in what someone else has already done.

name: 2 Corinthians 10:17
text: But "he who boasts, let him boast in the Lord."

name: 2 Corinthians 10:18
text: For it isn"t he who commends himself who is approved, but whom the Lord commends.

name: 2 Corinthians 11:1
text: I wish that you would bear with me in a little foolishness, but indeed you do bear with me.

name: 2 Corinthians 11:2
text: For I am jealous over you with a godly jealousy. For I married you to one husband, that I might present you as a pure virgin to Christ.

name: 2 Corinthians 11:3
text: But I am afraid that somehow, as the serpent deceived Eve in his craftiness, so your minds might be corrupted from the simplicity that is in Christ.

name: 2 Corinthians 11:4
text: For if he who comes preaches another Jesus, whom we did not preach, or if you receive a different spirit, which you did not receive, or a different "good news", which you did not accept, you put up with that well enough.

name: 2 Corinthians 11:5
text: For I reckon that I am not at all behind the very best apostles.

name: 2 Corinthians 11:6
text: But though I am unskilled in speech, yet I am not unskilled in knowledge. No, in every way we have been revealed to you in all things.

name: 2 Corinthians 11:7
text: Or did I commit a sin in humbling myself that you might be exalted, because I preached to you God"s Good News free of charge?

name: 2 Corinthians 11:8
text: I robbed other assemblies, taking wages from them that I might serve you.

name: 2 Corinthians 11:9
text: When I was present with you and was in need, I wasn"t a burden on anyone, for the brothers, when they came from Macedonia, supplied the measure of my need. In everything I kept myself from being burdensome to you, and I will continue to do so.

name: 2 Corinthians 11:10
text: As the truth of Christ is in me, no one will stop me from this boasting in the regions of Achaia.

name: 2 Corinthians 11:11
text: Why? Because I don"t love you? God knows.

name: 2 Corinthians 11:12
text: But what I do, that I will do, that I may cut off occasion from them that desire an occasion, that in which they boast, they may be found even as we.

name: 2 Corinthians 11:13
text: For such men are false apostles, deceitful workers, masquerading as Christ"s apostles.

name: 2 Corinthians 11:14
text: And no wonder, for even Satan masquerades as an angel of light.

name: 2 Corinthians 11:15
text: It is no great thing therefore if his servants also masquerade as servants of righteousness, whose end will be according to their works.

name: 2 Corinthians 11:16
text: I say again, let no one think me foolish. But if so, yet receive me as foolish, that I also may boast a little.

name: 2 Corinthians 11:17
text: That which I speak, I don"t speak according to the Lord, but as in foolishness, in this confidence of boasting.

name: 2 Corinthians 11:18
text: Seeing that many boast after the flesh, I will also boast.

name: 2 Corinthians 11:19
text: For you bear with the foolish gladly, being wise.

name: 2 Corinthians 11:20
text: For you bear with a man, if he brings you into bondage, if he devours you, if he takes you captive, if he exalts himself, if he strikes you on the face.

name: 2 Corinthians 11:21
text: I speak by way of disparagement, as though we had been weak. Yet however any is bold (I speak in foolishness), I am bold also.

name: 2 Corinthians 11:22
text: Are they Hebrews? So am I. Are they Israelites? So am I. Are they the seed of Abraham? So am I.

name: 2 Corinthians 11:23
text: Are they servants of Christ? (I speak as one beside himself) I am more so; in labors more abundantly, in prisons more abundantly, in stripes above measure, in deaths often.

name: 2 Corinthians 11:24
text: Five times from the Jews I received forty stripes minus one.

name: 2 Corinthians 11:25
text: Three times I was beaten with rods. Once I was stoned. Three times I suffered shipwreck. I have been a night and a day in the deep.

name: 2 Corinthians 11:26
text: I have been in travels often, perils of rivers, perils of robbers, perils from my countrymen, perils from the Gentiles, perils in the city, perils in the wilderness, perils in the sea, perils among false brothers;

name: 2 Corinthians 11:27
text: in labor and travail, in watchings often, in hunger and thirst, in fastings often, and in cold and nakedness.

name: 2 Corinthians 11:28
text: Besides those things that are outside, there is that which presses on me daily, anxiety for all the assemblies.

name: 2 Corinthians 11:29
text: Who is weak, and I am not weak? Who is caused to stumble, and I don"t burn with indignation?

name: 2 Corinthians 11:30
text: If I must boast, I will boast of the things that concern my weakness.

name: 2 Corinthians 11:31
text: The God and Father of the Lord Jesus Christ, he who is blessed forevermore, knows that I don"t lie.

name: 2 Corinthians 11:32
text: In Damascus the governor under King Aretas guarded the city of the Damascenes desiring to arrest me.

name: 2 Corinthians 11:33
text: Through a window I was let down in a basket by the wall, and escaped his hands.

name: 2 Corinthians 12:1
text: It is doubtless not profitable for me to boast. For I will come to visions and revelations of the Lord.

name: 2 Corinthians 12:2
text: I know a man in Christ, fourteen years ago (whether in the body, I don"t know, or whether out of the body, I don"t know; God knows), such a one caught up into the third heaven.

name: 2 Corinthians 12:3
text: I know such a man (whether in the body, or outside of the body, I don"t know; God knows),

name: 2 Corinthians 12:4
text: how he was caught up into Paradise, and heard unspeakable words, which it is not lawful for a man to utter.

name: 2 Corinthians 12:5
text: On behalf of such a one I will boast, but on my own behalf I will not boast, except in my weaknesses.
